data.enText: to frighten sb
You scared me.

data.chText: 想到楼里只有我一个人，怪害怕的。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: It scared me to think I was alone in the building.
to become frightened
He doesn't scare easily.
scare the shit out of sb
scare sb shitless
to frighten sb very much
frighten/scare the (living) daylights out of sb

data.chText: 吓得某人六神无主（或魂飞魄散）
data.enText: to frighten sb very much
frighten/scare sb to death
to frighten sb very much
frighten/scare the life out of sb

data.chText: 把某人吓得魂不附体；使魂飞魄散
data.enText: to frighten sb very much
scare sb↔away/off
to make sb go away by frightening them
They managed to scare the bears away.
scare sb into doing sth
to frighten sb in order to make them do sth

data.chText: 当地商家迫于威胁缴纳了保护费。
data.enText: Local businesses were scared into paying protection money.
scare sb↔off

data.chText: （尤指无意中）把人吓倒，使人害怕，使恐惧
data.enText: to make sb afraid of or nervous about doing sth, especially without intending to

data.chText: 不断上涨的价格把顾客纷纷吓跑了。
data.enText: Rising prices are scaring customers off.
scare up sth
to find or make sth by using whatever is available

data.chText: 我来看看能不能给大家凑够椅子。
data.enText: I'll see if I can scare up enough chairs for us all.
a situation in which a lot of people are anxious or frightened about sth
a bomb/health scare

data.chText: 近来人们对食物中的杀虫剂的恐慌
data.enText: recent scares about pesticides in food
a scare story (= a news report that spreads more anxiety or fear about sth than is necessary)
to cause a major scare
scare tactics (= ways of persuading people to do sth by frightening them)
a sudden feeling of fear
You gave me a scare !
We've had quite a scare.

data.chText: 以上各词均含使害怕、使恐惧之义。
data.enText: All these words mean to make sb afraid.
frighten

data.chText: 指（常为突如其来地）使惊吓、使惊恐：
data.enText: to make sb feel afraid, often suddenly

data.chText: 他掏出一把枪，把他们吓跑了。
data.enText: He brought out a gun and frightened them off.
scare
to make sb feel afraid

data.chText: 他们设法把那些熊吓跑了。
data.enText: They managed to scare the bears away.

data.chText: 以上两词均为通用词，意思非常相似，用任何一个均可。scare较frighten稍非正式。
data.enText: Both are very common words, and are very similar, so you can use either one correctly. Scare is slightly more informal than frighten .
frighten or scare?
alarm

data.chText: 指使惊恐、使害怕、使担心：
data.enText: to make sb anxious or afraid

data.chText: 谁都不认真对待这个问题，我非常担心。
data.enText: It alarms me that nobody takes this problem seriously.

data.chText: alarm的主语通常为事物、事件或形势，而非人：
data.enText: The subject of alarm is usually a thing, an event or a situation rather than a person.
You're alarming me.

data.chText: alarm用于形容不好的事情或危险将要发生的心情，多为忧虑而非真的害怕。
data.enText: It is used to describe a feeling that sth unpleasant or dangerous is going to happen in the future, and the feeling is often more of worry than actual fear.
frighten or alarm?
intimidate
to frighten or threaten sb so that they feel nervous or so that they will do what you want

data.chText: 他们被控胁迫选民投他们的票。
data.enText: They were accused of intimidating people into voting for them.
startle

data.chText: 指使惊吓、使吓一跳、使大吃一惊：
data.enText: to make sb feel suddenly frightened or surprised, usually because of sth sudden or unexpected

data.chText: 突然发出的响声吓了她一跳。
data.enText: A sudden noise startled her.
Stop it! You're frightening/scaring me !
Oh sorry. I didn't mean to frighten/scare/startle you .
to frighten/scare sb/sth away/off
I was frightened/scared/alarmed/intimidated/startled by what he said.
He frightened/scared/intimidated me into telling him what happened.
scare the shit out of sb
scare sb shitless
to frighten sb very much
frighten/scare the (living) daylights out of sb

frighten/scare sb to death

data.enText: Local businesses were scared into paying protection money.

data.enText: to make sb afraid of or nervous about doing sth, especially without intending to

data.enText: I'll see if I can scare up enough chairs for us all.

tr: sudden mass fear and anxiety over anticipated events
example: a bomb scare led them to evacuate the building
The stranger who hangs around the building frightens me

value.def: If something scares you, it frightens or worries you.

example.ex: What scares me most is that I'm going to end up not being married...
example.tran: 最让我担心的是我会一辈子嫁不出去。

example.ex: The prospect of failure scares me rigid...
example.tran: 一想到失败我就吓得身体发僵。

example.ex: It scared him to realise how close he had come to losing everything.
example.tran: 一想到他差点儿就失去了一切，他心里直打哆嗦。

defx.def: If you want to emphasize that something scares you a lot, you can say that it scares the hell out of you or scares the life out of you.
defx.tran: (表示非常害怕)吓死了，吓得魂都没了

value.def: If a sudden unpleasant experience gives you a scare, it frightens you.

example.ex: Don't you realize what a scare you've given us all?...
example.tran: 你难道不知道你把我们大家都吓得不轻吗？

example.ex: We got a bit of a scare.

value.def: A scare is a situation in which many people are afraid or worried because they think something dangerous is happening which will affect them all.

example.ex: ...the doctor at the centre of an Aids scare...
example.tran: 身处艾滋病恐慌中心的医生

example.ex: Despite the scare there are no plans to withdraw the drug.
example.tran: 尽管大家忧心忡忡，可是并无撤回药物的计划。

value.def: A bomb scare or a security scare is a situation in which there is believed to be a bomb in a place.

example.ex: Despite many recent bomb scares, no one has yet been hurt.
example.tran: 尽管最近发生多起炸弹恐慌，目前还没有人员受伤。

example.ex: ...a security scare over a suspect package.
example.tran: 可疑包裹引起的安全恐慌
